title: Geometry: Angles and Polygon Properties

vocab.definition: The space between two lines that meet at a point, measured in degrees
A closed shape made of straight line segments
The point where two sides of a shape meet (plural: vertices)
Lines that never meet and are always the same distance apart
Lines that meet at right angles (90 degrees)

teachingNotes: Practice identifying different types of angles and shapes. Teach properties of common polygons. Use real-world examples to show parallel and perpendicular lines.

sample.question: How many sides does a pentagon have?

truefalse.question: A right angle measures exactly 90 degrees.

fillintheblank.question: Lines that never meet and stay the same distance apart are called ________ lines.

shortanswer.question: Name two shapes that have exactly 4 sides.

wordProblems.question: A stop sign has 8 equal sides. What type of polygon is a stop sign, and how many vertices does it have?
